column4: I think you only need to use random a few times.  And only if you think someone will open up your drive in a lab
you can just install the regular version
I don't think that regular Ubuntu works with an EeePC
I know it does, I have installed it on my own eee
The subpages of "https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EeePC" list so many troubles with having regular Ubuntu on EeePC that I better either make the UNR work or change distro.
can you be more specific?

You see, you must patch/alter regular Ubuntu quite a lot, according to the pages, to make it work as should. I simply currently have to Panels issue which I'd want to solve to see if more issues arise. If more arises, I'll fix them up until they can't be fixed.
what page says you have to patch ubuntu?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EeePC
I don't see it, but you can do what you want.  Most of those pages are old, even the array.org kernel isn't needed anymore
Urgh. Google for "eeepc ubuntu" without the quotes and the first page there has "EeePC" in its right end
in its address.
oh, I see the page.  I just don't see what patching you have to do to get it working.  Again, I run regular ubuntu on eeepc already, so I know that all the issues there used to be have been fixed
Which EeePC ? I have 900 which I installed UNR onto
I think that lappy works better than 900 but okey, I'll test regular Ubuntu and will then report back
the only different between UNR and regular is the interface.  All the drivers were put into the kernel so are in both
Meaning that the UNR .img image's 300 megas larger size is due to more poor image format ?
no, it would be just different things installed
Hmmm, the "Fixes" page says that the page was last edited 2009-11-06. Well, off I go to test with the regular Ub
Oh, and I won't run 9.10 Karmic cuz it doesn't support my Nokia Internet Stick CS-15
oh, I see, that may change things, but good luck
